The TV set is still dead. But ... the bedroom door is open a crack and a very stran ORANGE LIGHT is creeping in from the main room.  And that to be from where the music is coming.

- as she gets out of bed. She's cautious and careful, moving slowly and quietly as wraps a robe around herself and moves to the door. The music continues to play. She opens the door slowly and walks through.

head_text.subj: INT. MAIN ROOM, JOEY'S APT. NIGHT

text: This room too is empty. The music is louder and the soft warm pulse of the orange is more distinct, bathing the walls and the furniture.
- as Joey tries to locate the source of the music and the light; The sofa. The bookshelfs. The TV - with the still and inactive Box. The closed drapes over the big picture window. Finally -

Both the music and the light seem to be centered on the c door across the room.  They're both coming from behind it Joey approaches the closet, still tense, still careful. opens the closet door and looks in. The closet is where Joey has stored her past.  But she's it neatly. Boxed and piled on shelves are old magazines, old greetin cards, old photographs, old soft-toys, college diplomas, clippings from small-town newspapers ("Death of a Local H Tommy Summerskill lost in Vietnam", "Joanne Summerskill C Valedictorian: looks to career in Media") etc etc. Also in there, stuffed away at the top of the closet, is radio - a big old wood-and-wire-grille valve driven beaut which the lilting music is coming. At some stage in its life, part of its casing was smashed and the pulsing orange light is its flickering vacuum tub It's an old mains-powered model and its mains cord dangle the shelf of the closet.  This radio isn't plugged into anything except the paranormal. CLOSE on Joey; staring at this broadcast from the beyond.
Joey reaches up and brings the radio down from the shelf out into the main room.  She sets it down on the coffee t in front of the sofa.

Formal, classical framing from a low angle - Joey and rad foreground, big picture window and its closed drapes in t background. Joey kneels up in front of the table. She stares at the radio with the same kind of trapped fascination with which we have seen characters in the pre HELLRAISER movies stare at the Box. Her fingers are drawn to the tuning dial as if to a puzzl She plays with the dial, moving through various "stations Joey's face is open with expectation as she moves through as if she is waiting for clues.  Or instructions. The music gives way to various VOICES; An Indian voice giving some kind of commentary.  The Engl words "BBC" and "World Service" are heard amidst the punj (Joey turns the dial) A tired sad English voice;
... and the King has sent a personal message of sympathy to the parents of those brave men who ...
(Joey turns the dial) A resonant French voice;
L'Oiseau chante avec ses doigts.  Deux fois.
(Joey turns the dial) Another burst of music, this time more raucous and syncop A ragtime tune from the birth of Jazz. (Joey turns the dial) Dead Air.  An ominous pause.  And Elliott's voice.
Joey.  Look out your window.

Joey shrinks back in nervous shock at this direct address The radio goes dead.  The tubes stop glowing.  The room i a dimly-lit place of shadow and suspense. Joey glances back over her shoulder at her closed drapes then at the silent radio. She stands up slowly and crosses to the drapes.  The came rises and TRACKS in as she walks, framing those drapes li curtains in a theater. With one strong gesture, Joey sweeps the drapes open.  An gasps. Instead of neighboring roof-tops and a view of the city, is looking directly into the interior of a Quonset hut. It is the image from her TV set though full-size, full-co and apparently real. At the far end, Elliott sits cross-legged on the floor. front of him on the floor is the puzzle box. Elsewhere in the hut; A camp-bed on which lie a gun-belt Officer's peaked cap.  And an old-fashioned radio - the s radio that is still in Joey's room.
- as she stares beyond her window into this impossible sc
Tell me ... Tell me ... Hello?

CLOSER on the elements in the hut, as we (and Joey) reali that everything in there is frozen in time.  There is no movement, no sound. Wonderingly (but carefully) Joey stretches her arm out be her.  When her arm reaches the threshold of the Quonset h disappears into the space once occupied by window glass. She pulls her arm back sharply with an intake of breath. she even takes a half-step backward.
I'm seven floors up ... I'm seven floors up! I can't ...
But she can. She summons her courage, steps over the sill, and walks i the impossible.

We are looking at a solid wall.  Then, through the wall, walks into the Hut, still bewilderment by the sights arou her. Still the image does not move.  Everything is very real, present.  But frozen. Joey approaches the immobile Elliott and looks from him t box and back again. (NB: Joey's speeches to the frozen Elliott are bravado; h face and body language betray her awed nervousness at the bizarre situation in which she finds herself.)
Now what?  I'm here.  Now what?  I just walked into madness for you.  Talk!
Joey looks back behind her.
There is no window back into the apartment, just a fourth
Great.  That's just great!  You bring me here.  You freeze up on me.  And now there's no way out.  I've had dates like you before.  I ...
A CREAK is heard OFF.  Joey looks up.
At the far end of the Quonset Hut, behind Elliott, a door creaked open an inch or two. Joey looks from the door back to the frozen Elliott.
Thanks.  I think.
Joey crosses to the door and opens it.  She walks through

Joey walks out onto the World War One battlefield of her recent dream.  She stands there - an incongruous vulnerab figure in her nightdress and robe - amidst the corpses, t trenches, and the distant plumes of smoke.
What's going on?  Is this a dream?
She glances back at the door of the hut she has just left
Within the hut, the frozen Elliott still sits.

- as she turns from looking into the hut and gasps, her e wide in shock. Standing on a hillock, framed against the grey battlefiel skies, is Elliott. Joey walks toward him. Elliott stands calmly and smiles at Joey.
Joey.  How kind of you to come.
A beat.  Joey (and the audience) take in Elliott's imposs presence, as she and he stand amidst the corpse-strewn fi
Wait ... wait.  You ... you have to help me.  I don't understand.  Am I dreaming this?
You have to help me.  You will understand.  And no, you're not dreaming.  Do you know where we are?
It's ... I don't know.  First World War, right?
Correct.  The fields of France.  And many dead flowers ... Oh.  Forgive me. My name was Spenser.  Elliott Spenser. Captain.
He extends his hand. Joey - slowly and nervously - puts her hand out to shake
Joey Summerskill.
Elliott smiles understandingly as he releases her hand.
Well done.  Brave girl.  You've probably never shaken hands with a ghost before, am I right?
Captain Spenser.  Elliott.  I ... What the Hell is going on?

Hell is precisely what is going on, Joey.  And we have to stop it.  I because of a special obligation, you because you're the only person who can help. And because you know what is right, and just, and true.  Will you walk with me a while?
He gestures with his hand and they begin to walk.

There were days in this war, days right on top of each other, when the newly dead were numbered in the tens of thousands.  They called it the war to end all wars.  Though it didn't.  You know that.  There were more wars.  More dead.  Your father's war.  Your dream search for your father led you here.  To me.  Joey, we need to talk.
Elliott does nothing dramatic - he doesn't clap his hands snap his fingers - but somehow, magically, he and Joey, w moving or changing position are back in the Quonset hut.
The frozen Elliott is still sitting on the floor before t box.  The mobile Elliott gestures at his frozen self as h speaks to the bemused Joey.

The war pulled poetry out of some of us. Others it affected differently.  This is me a few years later.  We're in India, by the way, and it's 1921.  I was like many survivors. Lost souls with nothing left to believe in but gratification. We'd seen God fail, you see.  So many dead.  For us God, too, fell at Flanders.  We adjusted to the loss.  And if we mourned, we mourned in silence. Thousands drank themselves to death. Others went further.  I went further.  I thought I was a lost soul.  But, until this frozen moment, I didn't even know what the phrase meant.
And what is ... this frozen moment?

The cusp of my life.  What I was, what I am, what I will be ... past, present, future, all bound here at this timeless moment of decision.  I was an explorer of forbidden vices and pleasures. Opening the Box was my final act of exploration, of discovery.
And what did you discover?
Something bad.
And why are you back?  Why are we here?
Again, no signal from Elliott but the background changes magically once more;
Elliott is once again framed dramatically on the hillock, standing close.

Because something worse is coming. (a beat) I opened the Box, Joey.  I found the monster within it.  And it found the monster within me.  For decades I served Hell with no memory of my former life until a friend released me.  You saw her.
Kirsty Cotton.  Yes.  But ... if your soul was freed, why are you back?

Because - monster as I was - I was bound by Laws.  The protocol of Hell.  The Box had to be opened to let me out.  The truly innocent were safe.  That's no longer true.  The shell of the beast has been fleshed.  What I was is out there, Joey.  In your world.  Unbound. Unstoppable.
What will he do?  What does he want?
He'll do what he does best.  But he'll do it unfettered.  He wants to walk the Earth forever, indulging his taste for all the myriad subtleties of human suffering.
What can we do?
I like you, Joey.  You ask all the right questions.  There is something we can do but it will require great courage.
I don't know ...
Elliott reaches out and strokes her cheek.  Gently.  Lovi We see in Joey's eyes that there is a response there.  A response beyond the comradely.
Joey, you walked through your window from one reality to another.  You're stronger than you think.
Then tell me what to do.
This is his first night on Earth.  He wants to close the door behind him. Like all Lieutenants, he covets command. There's a gateway to Hell through which he can be taken back.  He has to destroy it.
So where is it?
Your apartment.
Joey gasps.
The Box, Joey.  He wants the Box.

Lights flash.  Music pounds.  Kids dance.  It's a wild ni Under The Underground and it's about to get wilder. The source music (thrash metal) builds and builds, as if heading for a climax.  And then the climax comes.
The door BLASTS open explosively from within.  The pieces the shattered door FLY across the dance-floor, accompanie chunks of plaster and brick from the door-surround.

Flying wood and masonry hit people. One chunk SMASHES into the DJ console, bringing the music scratching, screeching end. Various SCREAMS are heard OFF through the ensuing silence In the confusion, kids scramble for the main doorway.  Is bomb?  Is it a street-gang attack? The Main Doorway SLAMS supernaturally shut, bolts flying place untouched by human (or inhuman) hand. Confused and frightened faces turn back to look at the so of the explosion.

Lit from behind by blinding beams of BLUE LIGHT, Pinhead emerges through the doorway.  Slow.  Elegant.  Terrifying Pinhead surveys the scene before him and the terrified an struck crowd look back at him. For the most part, the crowd are stunned into silence but are a few murmurs from them;
(ad-lib) Oh My God ... Jesus Christ! What the FUCK ... ?! No no no no no no no ....

Pinhead scans the club. He looks at the terrified humans.  The cruelly beautiful artworks.  The humans.  The artworks.  The humans.  The artworks. A small smile forms on his face.  He's just had an entert idea.

head_text.subj: INT. MAIN ROOM, JOEY'S APT. NIGHT

text: The view through the big picture window is entirely norma again; the cityscape by night. Suddenly, Joey seems to appear behind the glass - translu like a reflection - and comes through the window into her apartment, "solidifying" as she steps in. Her hands are at her head and she staggers forward a few It's as if the enormity of her trip thru realities has ju her.  She falls forward onto the floor of her room, uncon

- as the ringing of a phone grows in volume. Joey raises her head, bleary-eyed, and glances round the trying to locate the source of the noise that has woken h She crawls the few feet to the phone and snatches at it. hand-set falls and she has to gather it up from the floor Maneuvering herself into a sitting position, she speaks.
Hello?
(on phone) You wanted a story.  You got it.  Turn on the TV now.  And then get your ass down here ... (click) ...
Doc?  ...  Doc ... Hello?
She puts the phone down and rushes across to turn on the

head_text.subj: EXT. CITY STREETS, OUTSIDE CLUB NIGHT

text: The images are confusing, with the rapid pans and tempora loss of focus or light that characterise raw news footage Doc's Camera weaves amongst a mass of uniformed people, t to catch clear pictures of-what's been happening. Sirens howl, red emergency lights flash. It becomes clear we are looking at the aftermath of a dis Or a massacre. The club building looks like a bomb hit it.  Smoke and de litter the street.  So do corpses. Some of the dead bodies are simply dead bodies.  Others - glimpsed fleetingly and tantalizingly as Doc is jostled a bustled - seem to be mutilated decoratively.  In fact the hideous similarities to the artworks that used to grace t club: armless torsos wrapped in barbed wire; flayed limbs machinery inside instead of muscle.
(off) Judas Priest!  Will you look at ...
Suddenly, the images are blocked by a very BURLY COP push the camera and talking directly into it.
Move it!  Now!  No pictures!
(off) W-QQY.  I ...
I don't give a shit!  Move it or lose it!

head_text.subj: INT. MAIN ROOM, JOEY'S APT. NIGHT

text: CLOSE on Joey's face as she reacts in horror to what she seeing.    (INTERCUT with Doc's footage)
Oh my God, it's happening ...
Doc's camera pans around the area, past rubbernecking cro past shadowed alleys, past Police cars and ambulances veh ... and then whips back to an alley in the distance.
I thought ... what's ... I think there's something up there ...
Joey's eyes widen in horror as she speaks uselessly to th screen.
No!  No, Doc, don't ... don't ...

location: ALLEYWAY NIGHT BACK ON TV SCREEN

text: The hubbub and noise has died away.  Doc's camera is adva up a very dimly-lit alley.  Hardly any detail can be seen camera creeps forward ... forward ... forward ... Then suddenly a barely-glimpsed movement very close to th and the camera swings wildly toward it.
Shit!  What was ...

The face of Pinhead, almost lost to the darkness of the a is glimpsed on the screen as it looms toward the lens. The image disappears to darkness, over which Doc's SCREAM mortal terror and agony can be heard before the blackness suddenly replaced by a station identification card and th very harried anchorperson at a studio desk.
Well, we've ... er ... yes, we've temporarily lost our pictures there and ... and ...
Joey has her hands at her mouth in horror.
Doc!  DOC!!
Joey leaps to her feet, grabs the box from the TV, and st at it in her hand.

Joey's hands grip her steering-wheel tightly.  Her face i drawn and grim.  The Box is on the seat beside her. She i driving very fast. She has to slam on the brakes at a red light.  She pounds the dashboard in frustration.
C'mon.  C'mon!

head_text.subj: EXT. THE STREETS OF THE CITY NIGHT

text: CLOSE on a terrified face. The face belongs to EDDIE, a 20 year old runner for a dru gang.  His head is pressed tight against a brick wall.  H nose is bleeding and his eye is red and ready to bruise.
I'll get it!  I promise!  I'll ...
A fist slams into Eddie's face.
An alley.  Eddie is being held against the wall by two uniformed COPS, one in his 40's, one in his 20's.  The el cop has just punched Eddie in the face.
Don't promise me shit, you little fuck! You know what your promise is worth to me?  Huh?  Fifty per cent of fuck-all!
Give him the money, Eddie.
I don't ...
A big back-handed slap from the Elder Cop.
Give him the money, Eddie.
Just listen to me, Please!  I ...
The Elder Cop gut-punches him and Eddie doubles up.
I'm done listening, shit-brain!  Where you been all day?  They shut the school? Kindergarten closed?  No customers? Huh?  Huh?
Give him the money, Eddie.  Tell ya, I'm gonna puke if he beats on you any more. Just give him the ...
The Younger Cop pauses, looking beyond them down the alle long black shadow falls over them.
... money.  What the ... ?
The Elder Cop, at the change in his partner's tone, looks Standing in the center of the alley at its far end, light coming from behind him so that he is unclear, is Pinhead.
(Calm. Expecting obedience) You, fuckoff.
He turns back to Eddie.
Get your head outta your stinkin' ass and look at me, boy.
(still looking down alley) Hey ...
Pinhead is moving up the alley towards the action. Elder Cop shoves Eddie away.
(to Eddie) Get lost.
Eddie doesn't waste time with questions.  He's gone. The Cops straighten up and start walking to meet Pinhead. Pinhead advances- still in the shadows, still just a blac shape moving forward.
I have the distinct impression I told you to fuckoff.  Unless I miss my guess, you've just disobeyed an officer of the law.
Pinhead emerges into the (dim) light in the alley.
I am the Law.
Cops halt in shock at this awesome presence, both of them instinctively drawing their guns.  And both instinctively beginning to back up.
You're one butt-ugly son of a bitch and you're about to dead meat.
I am the son of eternal night and you are about to discover pain has no ending.
Well, that's enough of a direct threat for any officer of law.  Both cops fire their guns.  Once.  Twice.  Three ti Pinhead keeps walking.  He spits out the bullets that his has absorbed.
Oh shh ...

They empty their guns - useless - and then they turn and down the alley.  And then stop short.  There is a sudden of impenetrable blackness in front of them as if the worl simply comes to a stop four yards from their feet. The cops turn, terrified, to look back.  Instinctively, t spread apart - each walking near to opposite walls. The younger cop is standing beneath a fire escape.  He gl up as if he might be able to jump up to safety.  No.  Too Pinhead's head flicks upward as if in a gesture of comman Suddenly, the Fire escape ladder zooms downward with impo speed and force. The Younger Cop doesn't even have time to scream.  The la smashes right through his body, impaling him. His corpse stands there twitching and shuddering, wrapped around the ladder. Elder Cop stares in terror at his partner's fate.
No.  No.  No.  No.  No.  No.
Pinhead stands very still and speaks very calmly.
Curb your tongue.

The Elder Cop's body starts to move involuntarily.  His movements are jerky and spasmodic as if his mind is tryin fight what his body is trying to do. Pinhead's head moves through various positions.  His face calm, showing no particular pleasure at what he is doing only a fascinated concentration as if experimenting with found skills. The Elder Copts shaking puppet-like hands draw his handcu from his belt. His eyes show terror.  Everything else is beyond his cont He raises the cuffs to head level and springs one of them His mouth suddenly jerks open and his tongue protrudes. The fear in his eyes increases. He moves the open cuff over his tongue.  He's making pani moaning noises as if trying to scream. SLAM!  He drives the cuff closed right through his tongue And SCREAMS (as best he can). Pinhead looks beyond the Cop to the wall of blackness and another commanding gesture with his head. A Chain flies from the darkness and wraps itself around t other cuff. The chain pulls taut and then suddenly retracts into the darkness, hauling the Cop off his feet and dragging him a the alley into the blackness. The Cop screams and moans all the way until he is envelop into the darkness and then the sounds suddenly stop dead.

head_text.subj: EXT. CITY STREETS, NEAR CLUB NIGHT

text: A Paramedic is attempting to hold Joey back.  In the dist behind them is the wreckage of the club.  They are standi near the alley into which Doc's camera disappeared.
But I have to see him!  I'm his friend!
Lady, trust me!  You really don't want to go ...
But Joey has slipped past his obstructing arm and runs on the alley. And pulls to a horrified stop.
No!  NO!!

The scene is well-lit by Police emergency lights.  It is off by yellow DO NOT CROSS banners.  Paramedics and cops around in various states of shock or disgust. In the middle of it all is Doc.  Quite dead. The body is kneeling up, its cold hands resting on its la holding its severed head which stares up at its shoulders camera has been shoved deep between the corpse's shoulder blades and is angled down as if filming its dead face. CLOSE on Joey's devastated face.
An establishing shot of a church at the top of a small hi

The Church is in semi-darkness.  Some candles at an offer some others on an altar, provide the only light. On the very front pew a PRIEST sits, head bent low in pra The Priest is a young man.  Probably a good man.  We're n really going to have the time to find out. A shadow seems to pass over the Priest's bowed head. At first, it seems he hasn't noticed.  Then he looks up, little puzzled.  He looks to his right, his left, then sh in the pew to look back along the central aisle. There are rows and rows of empty pews and, in the distanc Church door ... which is ajar. The Priest stands, walks to the start of the aisle, and l back along it again.
(calling down aisle) Is there anyone there?  Hello?
Silence.  A beat. The Priest looks puzzled.  We see his mind work.  He's lo right, looked left, looked down ... How about ...? He turns right round to face the altar.
To the Priest, it's an image of nightmarish blasphemy.  E us heathens, it's pretty shocking; Pinhead in all his dark glory is standing behind the alta
How dare you!

It gets worse.  Pinhead, staring at the Priest all the wh reaches his hand to the back of his head and begins to ex one of the pins from his skull. The pin is horribly long and, sickeningly, the last few i aren't metal at all but some kind of infernal worm - dark slimy, and befanged. Pinhead presses the worm against his palm and it instantl burrows through his flesh pulling its pin-tail behind it. repeats the operation with the other palm. He turns his palms out to show the Priest in a blasphemou parody of Christ's stigmata.
I am the Way.
The Priest rushes up to the altar to Pinhead.
You'll burn in Hell for this!
The Priest reaches him.  Pinhead's hand is on his throat instantly, squeezing silence from him.
Burn?  What a limited imagination.

The choking Priest kicks and struggles as Pinhead forces his knees before him. Pinhead towers over the Priest.  He smiles. With his free hand he gouges out a piece of his own flesh the decorative wounds on his chest.  He holds the bloody of meat up.
This is my body.  This is my blood. Happy are they who come to my supper.

Pinhead shoves the disgusting lump of blue and bloody fle into the Priest's aghast mouth. Pinhead flings the priest away from him. The Priest lands heavily on the floor. Pinhead walks forward, smashing the altar aside. All the candles flicker as if an unheard wind is blowing through the Church. Pinhead walks up the aisle toward the semi-conscious Prie And all the candles go out.

Joey is driving again.  And this time she's not even stop at red lights.  She steams across junctions, leaving cars swerving and horns honking in her wake. Something catches her eye and she throws a glance to her
(appalled) Oh God ...
Up a side street, atop a hill, is the Inner-city Church. on fire. Joey swings the car up the hill.
Joey getting out of the car nearer the burning church.  O her side is a smaller building, the Church Hall. Joey shakes her head at the desecration.  She has no doub who's responsible.
Having fun en route, you bastard.
Suddenly, a CREAKING noise from behind her. Joey freezes in terror then slowly - very slowly - turns
The Priest - now mercifully dead - is crucified against t side wall of the smaller building.  Pinhead's nails protr from his palms and his ankles.
A SERIES of QUICK CUTS of Joey's car tearing through the darkness heading back to her apartment.

head_text.subj: INT. CORRIDOR, JOEY'S APT. BLDG. NIGHT

text: Joey rushes down the corridor to her apartment door, hurr turns the lock and rushes in.

head_text.subj: INT. MAIN ROOM, JOEY'S APT. NIGHT

text: Joey closes her door and switches on the light.  The mood suddenly different after the frenzied drive across town. very still, very slow, very quiet. Perhaps it's too quiet:  Joey moves into the room slowly, clutching the Box in her hands and glancing round.  Her m makes the mood suddenly creepy.  Is the monster already i house? Very slowly, very carefully, Joey begins to move round he apartment.  Hardly breathing, making no sudden movements, checks her doors.  The kitchen ... empty.  The bedroom .. empty.  The bathroom ... empty. Joey stands back in the center of her main room, facing o her big picture window.  Slowly, she lets out a big breat then draws an equally slow one in.  Maybe it's alright .. maybe the monster isn't here ... maybe ... Magically, eerily, slowly, the Box begins to rise from Jo hand.  Her eyes stare in horror as it ascends through the
Oh shit ...

Maybe there's one place she hasn't checked.  Swallowing nervously, Joey tilts her head up and back, her eyes risi in their sockets. The camera tilts low ... low ... lower ... taking in a wi view of the room and its ceiling and the ascending Box .. And the audience screams! Like a spider or a lizard, Pinhead is flat against the ce arms stretched out for balance, his face staring down at Joey throws her hands to her mouth and screams. Pinhead, angling down feet first, floats elegantly to the to stand facing Joey.  The Box lands in one of his outstr hands.  He holds it out to show Joey ... and then suddenl closes his powerful hand on it, apparently crushing it. He flings the remnants from him and they land on Joey's f Chunks and splinters of wood, whirring and spinning machi of gold and silver, and scores of tiny writhing worms.
No!
Watch.
Thanks to the miracles of trick photography, the remnants suddenly come back together and reassemble themselves int Box which sits there intact on the floor.
The Box can't be destroyed.  Like pain or the poor, it is always with us.  But as long as I have it, no-one can open it.  Now come here and die.  You have friends in Hell waiting to greet you.
Joey begins to back across the room toward her window.
You'll have to come and get me, you ugly bastard.
Spirited.  Good.  I'll enjoy making you bleed.  I'll enjoy making you enjoy it.

Pinhead starts across the room. Joey looks at her window.  It's the normal view ... with normal seven-story drop. Pinhead closes. She bites her lip, goes for it: in a literal and metaphor leap of faith she runs headlong at the window and jumps a The window shatters. Pinhead's arm reaches out after Joey as if to grab her an her back.
- shows his arm entering the shattered window and also sh the night-time cityscape beyond the window.  What it does show is the front of the monster's arm.  That's somewhere
CLOSE on Pinhead's arm, still clutching at the air. Suddenly, a khaki-uniformed arm moves into shot and grasp Pinhead's hand, arm-wrestling style.

Elliott literally pulls Pinhead through from one reality another - we see parts of the monster appearing and disappearing in front of the Hut wall as if glimpsed thro tears in reality.  It's like a tug-of-war which Elliott w Suddenly Pinhead's there on the floor of the Quonset hut. And his other self - Elliott - still has hold of his hand Pinhead throws a glance around the Hut.  He recognizes it and the frozen figure at the top end perched before the B
(furious rage) Aahhhh!!!
Joey!  Back to the wall, quickly!

Joey runs around then to the far wall - just in time beca now the pyrotechnics start. Elliott tightens his grip and (with a nice series of INTE CLOSE-UPS of these two alternative selves) the life-force Elliott and Pinhead begin to erupt. ELECTRIC BLUE LIGHT begins to play over both their bodies It's apparently agonizing, both figures arching with the both faces grimacing. Joey watches, wincing in sympathetic agony.
Elliott!  No!  What about you?!  Where will you be?!
Elliott grunts his answer through the agony.
Back with the damned.  No more hope of heaven.  But I drag this monster back with me!
You stupid interfering foo ... AAAAAH!

The essences of Pinhead and Elliott - drawn from their bo as sweeping, glowing, spitting arcs of BLUE LIGHT - crack the air of the Hut like a miniature electrical storm ... Until they suddenly lock together in one more powerful ar which flies at the body of the seated Officer and disappe inside him in a BLINDING FLASH OF LIGHT. And suddenly, as vision returns, there is only the seated officer   (and, at the far end of the room, Joey). And, almost as suddenly, the frozen scene comes to life; The radio near the camp bed is playing. A bead of sweat falls down the Officer's face as he reach forward to pick up the Box. The Officer, apparently completely unaware of Joey's pres begins to work the Box. As the process works through, we INTERCUT CONSTANTLY BETW 1)  The Officer's hands and the movements of the Box here the Hut in 1921. 2)  EXACTLY MATCHING movements of the Box back on the flo Joey's apartment in 1992.  Moving on its own, linked acro years to its earlier self. 3)  Joey watching the movements in the Hut.
Elliott? ... Elliott? ... You can't hear me, can you?  It's 1921.  I'm not really here ...

Suddenly, small patterns of BLUE LIGHT arc across the Box shocking the Officer who drops the Box and then stares in and fascination as ... On the floor, the box begins to open. The Officer kneels up and leans over the Box ... And the chains fly!  Shooting up from within and hooking themselves cruelly into the Officer's face and chest. CLOSE ON the Officer's face, howling in agony. CLOSE ON Joey's face, sobbing in distress.  She throws up hands to hide the unbearable sight from herself and, when lowers them, ...

head_text.subj: INT. MAIN ROOM, JOEY'S APT. NIGHT

text: .. she's back in her room. Alone.  Window intact.  Normal Joey stares around, her face a mix of sadness and relief. The mood now is very down, post-cataclysmic, post-adventu Joey takes a deep slow breath and crosses the room toward kitchen door. She crosses the floor without glancing down at it.  Why s she?  Everything's over.  But we notice, even if she does that the Box is no longer there.  But we hardly have time register this before ... Joey opens the kitchen door.
(SCREAMS!!!!)
Pinhead is framed in the doorway. Behind him, instead of her kitchen, is the black space of - like the Torture Rooms in HELLRAISER and HELLBOUND, it full of shadowy pillars and chains.
Oh, no kiss of welcome after 70 years?
Joey backs away, shaking her head in shocked denial. Pinhead moves forward, very leisurely.
This will be so good, Joey.  You loved him, didn't you?  I can feel him inside, weeping for you.  He can watch through the centuries as we discover the things that make you whimper.

Joey's mood breaks and she turns and rushes for her front She reaches it, throws it open ... and screams. JP Monroe is in the doorway - but he's only just recogniz He's now a CENOBITE - blue-skinned, scarred, mutilated, a decorated with metal and leather.
You never met, did you?  This was JP Monroe.
Have you seen what they did to me?  Have you seen what they did?  You interfering little whore!

The JP Cenobite moves into the room. Joey, now near hysteria, rushes across the room again to one remaining door - her bedroom. She throws that one open ... And Terri, the new FEMALE CENOBITE, walks out at her.  Sh the open Box in her hand and several cigarette protruding different holes in her cheek and face.
Terri?  Oh no!  NO!!  TERRI!!
Oh, go on.  Have one.  Fuck it.  You think you're going to live forever?
Pinhead and JP are advancing across the room toward Joey Terri.  Joey only has seconds to act ...
Wanna light, you bitch?!

Joey pulls her father's Zippo from her pocket and sparks as she swings it through the air close to Terri's face. A huge FLAME shoots out of the Zippo (as in the earlier s and scours across Terri's face. Terri howls in terror, throws her hands to her face ... a Box flies from her hands. Joey catches it, spins it, closes it! An arc of BLUE LIGHT zaps across to Terri and she's gone Still in one movement, swinging on her heels, Joey twists box again ... And another Arc of LIGHT zaps JP away ... Joey completes her turn.  She's facing Pinhead.  She hold Box before her like a weapon ... and she's got the monste her sights ...
Wait!
His hands are raised palms out.  He's stopped advancing. Joey holds the Box ready, breathing heavy, waiting ...
You can send me back.  But why?  I can help you, Joey.  I can give you what you want.
You'll never know what I want ...
(Despite what she's said, we see Joey's face register eve word of Pinhead's reply, every nuance, every promise ...
Respect.  Power.  You and I can put your name on the World's lips, your face on it's screens ...
Camera TRACKS closer to the Box in Joey's hands as Pinhea speaks.  Closer and closer until it's side fills the scre

CLOSE on the face of the Box, still filling the screen. SLOW PULL BACK to reveal that the Box is mounted on a pli within a glass bell-jar. PULL BACK continues.  The bell-jar stands on a tall thin sculpture stand. PULL BACK continues.  The stand is next to a large impres desk in an even larger even more impressive office. And seated behind the desk is ... well, we can't really c her Joey - she's far too impressive for that ... is Ms. J Summerskill. Her hair is different.  Her make-up is different.  Her cl are different.  Everything about this woman speaks of pow sophistication.
